Topic.Title: Can you change offline editor font size?

Posts.EditableText:
Hi.  I'm having fun learning to use Squiffy.  (Thanks for a great tool, Alex.)  However, it's the first time I've looked at HTML/CSS in a [b:16g2tgvh]long[/b:16g2tgvh] time.  Using the editor *online* is fine, but I'd like to be able to use it *offline* as well, and would prefer that.  Problem is -- the text editor font is [b:16g2tgvh]way[/b:16g2tgvh] too small me. (Windows 10, crappy 1366 x 768 LCD screen).  Otherwise, it seems to work fine.

If there's a way to increase the font size in the offline text editor itself (the actual script/code you write), could someone tell me how?  Thanks.

Posts.EditableText: Click on the "gear" button near the "build" button on the top right and then choose the font size of the editor window.

Right - I see you caught that before I edited my last post.

So - just to be clear for anyone else who wants to, but can't change font size in the offline editor:

- click on "Help / About Squiffy" in the top menu of the offline program. If you don't have the latest version of Squiffy, it will (if I recall) have the option to "Check for Updates." And clicking that will trigger a popup window for downloading the latest version.
